name: 施坤龍
objective: The general physics courses of our university are specially designed for students with engineering backgrounds. The main purpose is to encourage students to participate in the exploration of the mysteries and laws of the operation of nature, and to provide a solid foundation for subsequent professional courses. The content of this course includes mechanics, thermodynamics, acoustics, electromagnetism, optics and modern physics. The professor can design the course based on three hours per week and two semesters, and then consider the different needs of each department to strengthen or omit certain chapters.
schedule: Week 1: Chapter 1: Introduction and vectors; Week 2: Chapter 2: One-dimensional motion; Week 3: Chapter 3: Two-dimensional motion; Week 4: Chapter 4: Laws of motion; Week 5: Chapter 5: Application of laws of motion; Chapter Weeks 6 & 7: Chapter 6: Work and Energy; Week 8 Chapter 7: Potential Energy. Week 9: Midterm Exam; Week 10 & 11 Chapter 8: Momentum and Collisions; Week 12 & 13: Chapter 10: Newton’s Gravity Laws; Week 14 & 15: Chapter 11: Rotational motion; Week 16, Week 17: Chapter 12: Oscillatory motion; Week 18: Final exam;
